name: Kashmiri Pulao
history: Kashmiri Pulao is a famous North Indian dish originating from the Kashmir region. It is known for its unique combination of flavors and ingredients, including a variety of spices, dry fruits, and saffron, which give it a distinctive taste and aroma.
description: Kashmiri Pulao is a rich and aromatic rice dish that combines basmati rice with a blend of spices, nuts, dry fruits, and often garnished with fresh fruits. It's a mildly sweet pulao, often served on special occasions or as part of a feast.

instructions.title: Prepare Rice
instructions.description: Rinse the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak in water for 20 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: Cook Rice with Spices
instructions.description: In a pot, heat ghee and sautÃ© the cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, and cloves. Add the rice, water, saffron, and salt. Cook until the rice is done.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Dry Fruits
instructions.description: In a pan, heat some ghee and lightly fry the raisins, cashews, and almonds until golden. Set aside.

instructions.title: Assemble the Pulao
instructions.description: Mix the sautÃ©ed dry fruits and sugar into the cooked rice. Fluff gently with a fork.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish the pulao with chopped apple and pomegranate seeds. Serve hot as a main dish.

tips: Use high-quality basmati rice for the best flavor and texture.
Adjust the amount of fruits and nuts according to your preference.
variations: Add a pinch of ground cardamom for extra flavor.
Include other dried fruits like apricots or figs for variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.

presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl with a garnish of nuts on top.
Pair with a side of yogurt or raita for a complete meal.
